sec.p: Fresh flowers of T. minuta were collected from Cala community located in Sakhisizwe Local Municipality Eastern Cape Province, South Africa with geographical coordinates of 31° 33′ 0″ South, and 27° 36′ 0″ East [ 23]. Taxonomical identification of the plant was confirmed at.

Selmer Schonland Herbarium, Albany Museum Grahams town with Voucher No. BM01–040/2007 and the voucher specimen was deposited. Prior to essential oil extraction, plant material was rinsed with distilled water and shade dried on foil paper in the laboratory at ambient temperature for 6 days and thereafter, T. minuta flower was pulverized in a blending machine (Polymix PX-MFC90 D, Lasec/SA).
